drug.name: Probucol
drug.description: A drug used to lower LDL and HDL cholesterol yet has little effect on serum-triglyceride or VLDL cholesterol. (From Martindale, The Extra Pharmacopoeia, 30th ed, p993).
drug.synthesis-reference: Claudio Giordano, Giuseppe Barreca, "Process for preparing an intermediate useful in the syntheis of probucol." U.S. Patent US5157156, issued July, 1988.
drug.indication: Used to lower LDL and HDL cholesterol.
drug.pharmacodynamics: Probucol lowers cholesterol levels by increasing LDL (low-density lipoprotein) breakdown. Additionally, probucol may inhibit cholesterol synthesis and delay cholesterol absorption. Probucol is a powerful antioxidant drug normally used to prevent vascular disease caused by the free radicals in the body.
drug.mechanism-of-action: Probucol lowers serum cholesterol by increasing the fractional rate of low-density lipoprotein (LDL) catabolism in the final metabolic pathway for cholesterol elimination from the body. This drug may also act to inhibit the initial stages of cholesterol synthesis and act to inhibit the absorption of cholesterol from the diet. Recent information suggests that probucol may inhibit the oxidation and tissue deposition of LDL cholesterol, thereby inhibiting atherogenesis. It appears to inhibits ABCA1-mediated cellular lipid efflux.
drug.absorption: Absorption from the gastrointestinal tract is limited and variable (about 7%).
drug.half-life: Ranges from 12 hours to more than 500 hours, the longest half-life probably being in adipose tissue.

classification.description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as phenylpropanes. These are organic compounds containing a phenylpropane moiety.

category.category: Compounds used in a research, industrial, or household setting

food-interactions.food-interaction: Take with food. Food increases availability.

drug-interaction.name: Ivabradine
drug-interaction.description: Ivabradine may increase the QTc-prolonging activities of Probucol.

drug-interaction.name: Dofetilide
drug-interaction.description: The risk or severity of QTc prolongation can be increased when Probucol is combined with Dofetilide.

polypeptide.name: ATP-binding cassette sub-family A member 1
polypeptide.specific-function: cAMP-dependent and sulfonylurea-sensitive anion transporter. Key gatekeeper influencing intracellular cholesterol transport.

go-classifier.description: ATPase activity, coupled to transmembrane movement of substances
negative regulation of macrophage derived foam cell differentiation
positive regulation of cAMP biosynthetic process
regulation of Cdc42 protein signal transduction
response to laminar fluid shear stress

article.citation: Jeon SM, Park YB, Kwon OS, Huh TL, Lee WH, Do KM, Park T, Choi MS: Vitamin E supplementation alters HDL-cholesterol concentration and paraoxonase activity in rabbits fed high-cholesterol diet: comparison with probucol. J Biochem Mol Toxicol. 2005;19(5):336-46.

polypeptide.name: Liver carboxylesterase 1
polypeptide.specific-function: Involved in the detoxification of xenobiotics and in the activation of ester and amide prodrugs. Hydrolyzes aromatic and aliphatic esters, but has no catalytic activity toward amides or a fatty acyl-CoA ester. Hydrolyzes the methyl ester group of cocaine to form benzoylecgonine. Catalyzes the transesterification of cocaine to form cocaethylene. Displays fatty acid ethyl ester synthase activity, catalyzing the ethyl esterification of oleic acid to ethyloleate.
